general_advisory: As per IMD there may be chances of light to moderate rain, so farmers are advised to keep harvested matured paddy crops in a safer place. Provide stacking to fruits & vegetables. Harvestable vegetables should be plucked before rain and dispose in the market. Don’t spray insecticide & herbicide during rainy hours.

advisory: There may be chances of light to moderate rain, so farmers are advised to keep harvested matured paddy crops in a safer place.
Store them in a safe place by covering with a polythene sheet.
Make the threshing floor and storage godown clean and spray Lambda Cyahalothrin 4.9CS@ 1.5ml/li of water to minimize the chance of future infestation of storage pest.
Withhold application of fertilizer and pesticides for the time being.
Drain out excess water from the field.
Check for diseases & other pests in mustard due to foggy weather.
Make arrangement for covering plastic cover or polythene sheet for vegetables nursery like brinjal, tomato and cole crops.
Postpone spraying operations of pesticide & foliar fertilizer application.
Harvestable vegetables should be plucked before rain and dispose in market.
Provide mechanical support to fruit plants to prevent lodging.
Pluck the matured fruit before rainfall & disposed in the market.
Cover plastic bag to the fruits of banana.
There is a possibility of “EUS” disease in fish. Farmers are advised to apply „Cifax‟ @ 400 ml mixed with 40 liters of water in one-acre pond area as a preventive measure.
Keep the animals inside the shed.
Avoid mixing rainwater into drinking water of animals.
